audio_caption: The audio clip begins with dark, foreboding synth music that establishes a somber mood. This fades slightly to introduce a single male voice speaking in a theatrical tone, welcoming listeners to a special Bullet Club show. He identifies himself as the host, "The American Nightmare", and previews a conversation with the IWG Heavyweight champion, Kenny Omega. The music then fades in again as the speaker invites listeners to relax, followed by the distinct sound of a lighter flicking.

The clip starts with a male speaker with an energetic tone introducing a message from his "main man," Hangman Page, whom he's known through thick and thin. This transitions to the speech of another male speaker, Hangman Page, who speaks in a reflective tone about stepping up in singles action and mentions fights with Jay White, Ibushi, and Kenny. The music then fades in, consisting of an ominous and foreboding sound that accompanies Hangman's last statement, giving the impression of suspense. There are sounds of whooshing or swishing, as well as bell ringing, in the background throughout.

The audio clip begins with a deep male voice wishing Hangman Page the best of luck in the G1. The speaker further notes the upcoming tag-team match on July 7th featuring Hangman and Marty Scurll against Kushida and Hiroshi Tanahashi. Then, a male speaker, with a distinct British accent, exclaims "Villain, you're up," and introduces "Marty Scrawl, Hangman Page," emphasizing "the stud" taking on Tanahashi and Kushida. Throughout the speech, there is low-frequency ambient noise.

The clip begins with speech from a single male speaker, seemingly addressing someone named "Okishida." The speaker acknowledges having been beaten in a competition, the "Best of Super Juniors," but excuses this loss by citing severe jetlag from a flight from Chicago and lost luggage. The tone is slightly sarcastic and frustrated. The speaker continues, indicating that while Okishida may have won against a tired opponent, he will now have to travel by plane as well.

The audio clip consists solely of speech by one male speaker. He begins with a fairly even, slightly urgent tone, saying "You're going to have to fly to San Francisco." As he continues, the tone becomes more aggressive, rising in pitch and volume as he threatens to grab and snap fingers, and rip out and shove hair down someone's throat. The clip concludes with a forceful "Yeah!"

The clip begins with a male voice, speaking with intensity and determination, rallying others to bring their tools for a confrontation: "bring your ax and all, bring your wrench, bring whatever you have." He continues, identifying adversaries Marty Scurll and Hangman Page, declaring they will put an end to them "Bullet Club style." Simultaneously, a background sound is heard that seems to be an inhalation or sniff.

The clip starts with a male speaker remarking on "spunk" and "energy displayed by the villain Marty Scrull". He notes he would be "remiss in his duties as leader of the Bullet Club" if he didn't mention "faction warfare." There are no other sounds in the clip.

The audio begins with commentary previewing a wrestling match with a hype-filled tone, promising a "Bullet Club OG" to give the floor to. The commentator excitedly introduces "The Guerrillas of Destiny". This segues into a brief but enthusiastic outburst from a male voice, declaring "Oh my GOD!".

The audio clip features a male speaker, speaking in an assertive tone about "Bullet Club" coming to "San Francisco" on "July 7th". He continues to discuss "New Japan Pro Wrestling back in California," the "G1 Special," and names several wrestlers, including "Shoyo Rocky," "Tama," "me," "Chase," "Gedo," and "Yoshi-Hashi". He describes how he loves a party, the more the merrier and wonders "who would San Francisco love to party with".

The audio begins with a male speaker recounting a story, mentioning inviting "the Tokyo pimp" Takahashi Yujido and discussing who knows "the cow palace" best. The tone is conversational. Following this narrative, there is a pronounced laugh, transitioning into what sounds like a party shout. Lastly a musical piece begins with a prominent guitar riff.

The audio clip starts with a forceful, guttural shout. Then a man speaks with an assertive tone, referencing "Kenny Omega, Cody Rhodes" and a fight over leadership of the "Bullet Club" in "San Francisco," followed by a distorted, echoing "I." He continues in a more conversational tone, expressing excitement about talking tag teams, specifically mentioning the "IWGP Heavyweight Tag Team Champions," "The Young Bucks" and an upcoming Dominion rematch. Two male voices, likely the Young Bucks, take over in a spirited, slightly boastful manner, hyping up their match against "Evil and Sanada," declaring themselves "California boys". This is interspersed with a shout from the crowd.

The clip begins with a male speaker announcing that it is time for "the main event." He is speaking in an excited tone, and he continues by stating that Kenny Omega has defeated Okada and become the IWGP Heavyweight Champion. The speaker questions what that makes him, concluding that he is "the man who beat the man who beat the man."

The clip begins with a male speaker accusing someone of having "too many distractions," lacking focus, and working too hard to have ownership over their life. His tone is accusatory and harsh. This is followed by the sound of running water, which fades in to provide some background ambiance.

The audio clip begins with speech, a male voice speaking with a slightly mocking tone, highlighting the word "distractions." The speaker continues, making references to "leadership of the bullet club" and "the publicity stunt known as the Golden Elite." Subsequently, there's a shift to background music with a serious or intense tone.

The audio clip begins with a man speaking in a sinister tone, warning against distractions and mentioning "Kota Ibushi". He further threatens to "reach in your body and take it from you" and warns about living dreams and nightmares at the same time. Following this threat, a metallic clang is heard, succeeded by an ominous buzzing sound and then a loud crash.
